commands.launch-timberborn.title: Launch Timberborn
commands.open-docs.title: View Timberborn Documentation
commands.translate-localizations.title: Translate localizations
commands.project-setup.title: Create project files
configuration.launch-args.settlement-nam: Sets the name of the settlement
configuration.launch-args.save-name.desc: Sets the name of the save file
configuration.launch-args.safe.descripti: Launch the game in safe mode
configuration.docs-links.description: Additional documentation links to include in the lists
configuration.docs-links.label.descripti: The label shown for this links
configuration.docs-links.description.des: The description shown for this link
configuration.docs-links.url.description: The URL of the documentation link
configuration.loc-files.description:
All loc files and their language
1st item is source file
configuration.loc-files.path.description: The file path from the workspace root
configuration.loc-files.language.descrip:
The language of the file
nl & cs are timberborn mods
wakltroughs.getting-started.title: Get Started with timberborn modding extension
wakltroughs.getting-started.description: Learn about the features of this extension
walktroughs.getting-started.project-setu:
You can generate the project files to get started quickly
You can chose between a basic or unity project
[Try it out](command:timberborn-modding-ext.projectSetup)
walktroughs.getting-started.json-validat:
This extension will check the specification files for potential errors and help with autocomplete
It will also check localization keys and show their value on hover
walktroughs.getting-started.code-snippet: This extension adds snippets for specification, translation and code files
You can launch the game from the command palette
[Try it out](command:timberborn-modding-ext.launchGame)
The launch parameters are configurable in [settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings)
walktroughs.getting-started.translate-lo:
You can auto translate the localizations
[Try it out](command:timberborn-modding-ext.translateLocalizations)
You must first configure timberborn-modding-ext.locFiles in [settings](command:workbench.action.openFolderSettings)
walktroughs.getting-started.documentatio:
You can quickly open the documentation
[Try it out](command:timberborn-modding-ext.openDocsLinks)
You can add more links in [settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings)
walktroughs.getting-started.timberborn-t:
Use the timberborn themes
[Set color theme](command:workbench.action.selectTheme)
[Set file icon theme](command:workbench.action.selectIconTheme)
[Set product icon theme](command:workbench.action.selectProductIconTheme)
